resource.chars:
<u>Description of the Figures</u>
<u>Thaumantias --- </u>?
Fig. 1. Disc seen from above  1.a. imaginary vertical section
2. Opening of the Stomach into the canals seen from above
3. Marginal tentacles
4. Young generative organ
<u>Mesonema -? </u>
Fig. 5. Lateral view of the animal. 5a. Vertical Section
6. View of [text?] a segment of the disc. under surface
a. buccal tentacles. b. canals. c. marginal membrance (Fig. 20)
7. a single buccal tentacle much magnified
8. A Portion of the Marginal Canal with a tentacle &
two marginal corpuscles
9. Portion of the marginal canal (a) with young tentacle (b)
and a marginal vesicle containing two corpuscles each inclosed
within a delicate cell wall
10. A marginal vesicle [text?] highly magnified - the two 
corpuscles do not appear to have attained their full
development as they refract less and the cell appears 
more opaque.
<u>Oceania</u> ---?
Fig. 11. Lateral view of the animal. 11a. Vertical Section  
- 12. Part of the under surface of the disc. a. a marginal membrane
b. canals & Generative organs. c. common cavity
- 13. Part of the membrane surronding the mouth
- 14. The edge of this much magnified
- 15. Part of the margin of the disc much enlarged. a. Marginal membrane. b. canal & Generative orgs. c. tentacle. d. margl. corpuscles. g. circular
canal
